channel.title: Autoclicking
channel.description: Alright, so I don't even know how the bot detection works in RS3, but here's my question. Exactly how detectable are auto-clickers? Not bot clients, or anything like that, just a program to emulate mouse clicks. I assume there are some sort of systems in place that detect exact mouse positions over a period of time, and to check for patterns and what not. But there's a few pretty advanced ones out there, that could move the mouse within a certain range, and click at intervals and what not (if not it could easily be achieved via Java's Robot class). Thoughts?

item.title: Autoclicking
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:

Death Style:

tape a wireless mouse to your hand

That’s hilarious.

item.title: Autoclicking
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

If the clicker supports slight randomization (so that it isnt the exact same spot everytime) and you are watching it to move it a bit more every now and then, reply a bit to chat, give it breaks etc, you should be fine. I haven’t risked botting on 07 because everyone says its such a high ban rate and its my main, but if I was going to it would probably be that.

Read full topic
